snippet: A Vietnamese man accused of helping develop online propaganda for Al Qaeda’s affiliate in Yemen has been extradited from Britain to face trial in Manhattan, United States prosecutors said Tuesday.
abstract: United States prosecutors extradite Vietnamese man, Minh Quang Pham, from Britain to face trial in Manhattan on charges he created online propaganda for Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula; indictment says in 2010, Pham was in Yemen, swore allegiance to Al Qaeda and helped the group produce English-language online magazine called Inspire.
lead_paragraph: A Vietnamese man accused of helping develop online propaganda for Al Qaeda’s affiliate in Yemen has been extradited from Britain to face trial in Manhattan, United States prosecutors said Tuesday.

headline.main: Britain: Man Linked to Militants in Yemen Is Extradited to the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Britain: Man Linked to Militants in Yemen Is Extradited to the U.S.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
